utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Help!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Help! Help me!

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: They’re in another country. How is that possible?

utterance.speaker: FBI AGENT HARRIS
utterance.content: We don’t know. But clearly the kidnappers were working for outside interests. The voices on the call have been identified as Egyptian.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This isn’t a kidnapping for ransom, is it? Why are they in Paris?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They took your daughter there and my daughter along with her. There must be a reason.

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: I don’t know!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They are covering their tracks! Why?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Show them the sketch.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: A neighbor spotted this man coming out of the farmhouse driveway after the girls were taken. Do either of you recognize him?

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: No, he’s not familiar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what’s our next step?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: The Skype call was made over a cellular data network. So we have isolated the signal to a 30 square kilometer area.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 30 square kilometers is the whole city.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: I know. But hopefully an analysis of the video will give us a clue as to where they’re being held. In the meantime we’re reaching out to the embassy to establish -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Reaching out? What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Uh, there are certain protocols we have to follow before we can move forward. Permissions we have to get.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And how long will that take?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: A day or two at the most.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A day or – Our daughters are out there right now. They need our help right now!

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: If you want to help your daughter, you’re going to have to be patient.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She sounded so scared. I could hear it in her voice, just like when she was a little girl. And there was nothing I could do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She wasn’t hurt, Castle. That’s what matters. That’s what we hold on to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just want her home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re not giving up yet.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Hey. They just called El-Masri with terms.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: It’s too soon. We can’t be in position in time.

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: I don’t care. I’m getting her back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did they say?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: It was a ransom demand. 15 million Euro from anti-Mubarak dissonants. They set an exchange three hours from now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: In Paris, down by the Seine. Mr. El-Masri, you have to let me contact the local authorities.

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: No! They were clear. They see police, my daughter dies. We’ll pay to get her back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did they – – did they say anything about Alexis?

utterance.speaker: LINA
utterance.content: Anwar insisted. And they’ve agreed to release both our daughters.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If there is anything I owe you –

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: You owe me nothing.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: If the police aren’t involved then who’s making the drop?

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: My wife has a sister living in Paris. Her husband will do the exchange. Now if you’ll excuse us, we have many calls to make.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: Just pray these men are honorable.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: There are security cameras covering that part of the Seine. At the very least maybe we can get a tap in. See who these guys are.

utterance.speaker: TECH GUY
utterance.content: Sir. We’re live.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Any activity?

utterance.speaker: TECH GUY
utterance.content: Looks deserted so far.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: There. Can you get any closer?

utterance.speaker: LINA
utterance.content: That’s him. That’s Achmed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This doesn’t even seem real. Like some kind of show.

utterance.speaker: LINA
utterance.content: Achmed!

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Get the Paris police on the phone, now.

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: No, no, no! Wait, wait. Wait.

utterance.speaker: LINA
utterance.content: No. No!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where – where are they? Where are the girls?

utterance.speaker: ANWAR
utterance.content: He has her. She’s safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s Alexis?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Agent Harris just spoke with Sara. She and Alexis were separated after the escape attempt and that was the last time that she saw her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They got what they wanted. She’s of no value anymore.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t know that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’re you going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To tell my mother. She doesn’t know yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll go with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. I need to do this alone.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Castle may be right. Sara was the objective. Alexis is just a liability now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why didn’t they bring her to the exchange?

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: Same reason they took her. A bargaining chip. Insurance in case something went wrong.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Insurance they don’t need anymore.

utterance.speaker: HARRIS
utterance.content: We’ll keep moving forward. But we have to manage our expectations now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Agent Harris, I’m not going to manage expectations. I’ll be solving a murder. The girl’s kidnapper, Roger Henson, was tortured and killed, most likely by the people that hired him. We find those people, we will find Alexis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, it’s me again. Can you just call me when you get this?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Still not answering?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Welcome. Any luck on the dead guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Henson’s been … completely off the grid. I can’t even find a known address.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, here’s what I don’t get. How does a mid-level narcotics smuggler get hooked up with a bunch of Middle Eastern radicals?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, I can’t find a connection if I don’t even know where to start. How are you guys doing on the planes?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan and I have been through every flight plan of every private jet that’s departed from here to Albany. And only a couple of them filed flight plans for France. So far they all seem legit. So Ryan and I are going to expand our search in the morning.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Kate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You should go. He needs you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Kate! Thank God. Is there any news?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. Not yet. But we’re doing everything that we can.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, where’s Richard?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought that he was with you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No! He told me he was going to be with you, working on the case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha, I haven’t seen him all day.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No. It’s gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s gone?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ugh, it’s so stupid. It’s just – stupid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Pick up, pick up, pick up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard! Where are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m at the precinct with Beckett. Why?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Don’t lie to me, Richard. Beckett is here, your passport is gone. Now what the hell do you think you’re doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Getting my daughter back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Paris? What the hell’s he doing in Paris?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He thinks that he can find her.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: What, so he’s Liam Neeson now?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Liam Neeson? The dude’s barely Ashley Judd.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, in the state that he’s who knows what he’s capable of. But he says that he knows someone that can help.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You gonna go after him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And lose a day flying out there and another one tracking him down in a place that I don’t have jurisdiction or authority? No. Look, he’s – he’s acting like a father and … I have to act like a cop. Can you circle back with the Feds? Have them widen the search to any private jets flying out to anywhere in Europe. And Ryan, I’m hitting a wall with Roger Henson. You think you can reach out to your guys in narcotics? Maybe they heard something on the streets.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, you guys, I don’t know who Castle thinks he knows, but let’s find his daughter before he does something stupid and gets himself killed.

utterance.speaker: GASTON
utterance.content: Merci, Colette. Et si jamais vous quittez votre petit ami – – Richard!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello Gaston.

utterance.speaker: GASTON
utterance.content: Richard, I am so terribly sorry. If there’s anything I can do –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re still working as an advisor to the Administrator of Defense, right?

utterance.speaker: GASTON
utterance.content: Yes, but that gives me very little pull with the Police Nationale. I can make inquiries though.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I – I appreciate it. I’m not really looking for a bureaucratic runaround. When you were advising me on those last few Derrick Storm novels you mentioned a man that the French government would sometimes hire when they couldn’t afford to take official action.

utterance.speaker: GASTON
utterance.content: Ricky, I told you that in confidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But he exists.

utterance.speaker: GASTON
utterance.content: It is one thing to write about these characters from the safety of your own desk. But men like this? They are not the kind of people you ever want to know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beatrice, she must be what, 14 now? Patrice is going on 9. I want you to think about how it feels when you hug them. The look in their eye when you come home. Now imagine them gone.

utterance.speaker: GASTON
utterance.content: He’s expensive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t care. Gaston, please.

utterance.speaker: GASTON
utterance.content: Stay close to your phone.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett! They didn’t fly to Paris. At least not at first. FAA shows a Dassault Falcon left departing Teterboro to Brussels 18 hours after the girls were taken. The plane was then designated a medical angel flight transporting two young women awaiting organ transplant from Brussels to Paris.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alexis and Sara.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: French immigration met them at the plane and processed the girls before they were loaded onto an ambulance. They were both unconscious at the time.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: That’s how they did it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we know about the plane?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s owed by one of those Russian oligarchs. A Vladimir Abramivich.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how is he connected to the El-Masris?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s not. In fact, it’s possible he’s not even involved. His plane was in Paris under repairs and none of his people even knew it was taken.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: These people stole a jet?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For a simple hostage exchange? That doesn’t add up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey so, I talked to my guys in narcotics. They didn’t seem to know much about what Henson had been into recently or where he’d been living, but they did know something that we didn’t. Henson had a girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: JACQUE HENRI
utterance.content: “Vengeance is mine”, sayeth the Lord. “I will repay.” Sometimes the Lord needs a little help, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you for coming.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Don’t thank me yet. My terms. Half now, half when I find her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you? Find her?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Yes. But I don’t promise to find her alive. That, I’m afraid, is out of my control.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where do we start?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: I understand there is a recording of a call she made to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you – Yeah, there’s a recording.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: I need a copy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s nothing on it that indicates where she is.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: And who told you that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The FBI.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: And then you thank God I’m not the FBI.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Come.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: To see a friend.

utterance.speaker: THE MOLE
utterance.content: Bonjour, Henri!

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Bonjour!

utterance.speaker: THE MOLE
utterance.content: Monsieur Castle, I presume.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. And you are?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: We call him la taupe – the mole.

utterance.speaker: THE MOLE
utterance.content: Il est tendu, eh?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Pas mal, eh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Says you’re nervous. He can hear your heart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I told you, there’s nothing on there. Nothing to see or hear.

utterance.speaker: THE MOLE
utterance.content: Ah, you listen with your eyes. Shh.

utterance.speaker: THE MOLE
utterance.content: There. Hear that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: THE MOLE
utterance.content: Right there. Church bells.

utterance.speaker: THE MOLE
utterance.content: Saint George’s in the … sixteenth. From the sound of it, she’s 6, maybe 8 blocks away. And there’s a restaurant in the building she’s in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you tell that?

utterance.speaker: THE MOLE
utterance.content: Sounds, Monsieur Castle, are like fingerprints. No two are alike. Ah, that hum? That’s from a restaurant ventilation system. Commercial grade.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: When was the last time you slept?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – I don’t know. I’m good.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: No, this will take some time. I will wake you when we find something, hmm?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: They’re coming. They’ve realized we’re gone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Baby, get out of there. Get out of there now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Degarmo, I’m going to ask you again. What else can you tell me about Roger Henson’s murder?

utterance.speaker: PAULINE DEGARMO
utterance.content: I don’t have to tell you nothing. I know my rights. You can’t keep me here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s dead. Tortured. I’m just trying to find the people that did it to him.

utterance.speaker: PAULINE
utterance.content: Listen, b*tch. I don’t talk to cops. Now go get me my lawyer and then go to hell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you have any idea what this is all about? You think I’m some beat cop busting you on possession charges? My partner’s daughter is missing and you – – are in my way. Now you don’t talk to cops? I’m not a cop today, honey. Now, who was he working for?

utterance.speaker: PAULINE
utterance.content: He didn’t say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s this guy?

utterance.speaker: PAULINE
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: PAULINE
utterance.content: But Roger got strange calls in the middle of the night. People with accents.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of accents?

utterance.speaker: PAULINE
utterance.content: Foreign.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What phone did he use?

utterance.speaker: PAULINE
utterance.content: He didn’t give me the number!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good. I believe you. Now you’re going to give me his address.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It looks like somebody got here first.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These people hired him to kidnap those girls. So why would they torture and murder him? Why would they toss this place?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe it wasn’t the same guys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who else is it gonna be? Check with the neighbors. See if they saw anything.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett. A computer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get it to tech. Tear it apart. Find me something. Anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s going on? You found something?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Maybe. Acoustic tiles, office space, close to a rooftop. Might fit the bill.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m coming.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: No, no, no. It might not be the place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t care.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: It might be the place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My daughter. My money. I’m coming.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They were here.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: This is not the work of typical kidnappers. The place is clean. It’s too clean. This is trade craft.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trade craft as in spies?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Whoever is behind this has intelligence training. They left no trace.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So how do we find them?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said you could find them.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Shh!

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: They’re listening. So if the cops find this place they stay ahead of the investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are these people?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Let’s find out.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: I know you’re out there. I know you’re listening, so you know I’m not a cop. I’m not interested in you, your cause, or the law. All we want is the girl. Now you got what you wanted. Now she’s meaningless to you, but not to me. So, if you’re smart you call, we discuss terms. But if you’re stupid, then I’ll come for you. I expect by now you have run voice recognition, so you know who I am, you know my reputation, and you know what I will do when I find you. The choice is yours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sans le père? Without the father?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Don’t you see? This is good news. They want to negotiate. It means she’s safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not having that meeting without me.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: You’re emotionally compromised. That makes you like an animal to them. Unpredictable and dangerous. Mr. Castle, this is what I do. It’s what you paid me for. Now let me meet with them. Let me negotiate the terms.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Oh, well of course they will ask for more money. I need to know. How much can you afford?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett. One of Henson’s neighbors saw someone leaving his apartment two days back. We just got the sketch. It’s the same dude who was spotted leaving the farmhouse where Henson was found.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: First he tortures Henson and then he trashes his place. Why? Where are you with Henson’s hard drive?

utterance.speaker: TECH GUY
utterance.content: It’s been erased. And not with commercial software.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you able to pull anything from it?

utterance.speaker: TECH GUY
utterance.content: I’ll do what I can, but I wouldn’t get your hopes up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do it. We gotta figure out what he was looking for.

utterance.speaker: THE MOLE
utterance.content: Don’t worry. Henri always comes through.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shouldn’t he be back by now?

utterance.speaker: THE MOLE
utterance.content: He is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was she there?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Yes. And she is safe. This is today’s paper.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why did they take her?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: It was convenient. But they’ve agreed to let her go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Later today. In the Forest of Fontainebleau. It will give you time to get the money together.

utterance.speaker: TECH GUY
utterance.content: Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: TECH GUY
utterance.content: Henson was looking at these. Surveillance photos.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh God. Alexis. She wasn’t at the wrong place at the wrong time. She was the target.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s Alexis? I don’t see her.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Stay calm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no. This isn’t right. It’s not right.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Don’t move. He’s yours, like we agreed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re selling me out? Why?

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: I value my life more than my word. If I had known who was really holding your daughter, who your daughter really is –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who she really is? That – I – I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: I never would have taken the job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s nobody.

utterance.speaker: HENRI
utterance.content: Mon paiement?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ow! Wait, okay, wait. Just – what do you want?

utterance.speaker: JACKSON HUNT
utterance.content: Ah, ah, ah.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: If I’d wanted you dead, you’d be dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re the guy in the sketch. You were at the farmhouse.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: That’s right. Your friend there was pretty good. A bit out of his league. I am not surprised he crossed to the other side.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what’s going on here? You – you know where my daughter is?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Look, we’re exposed here. We gotta go. Now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Go? What are you talking about? Go where?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Somewhere safe. Get in the car.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, not until you tell me what’s going on. Beckett. I am so glad you called.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, Alexis wasn’t taken by accident. She was the target. They wanted her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Listen, I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing? That was a $200 phone!

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: That’s how they track you. Now get in the car.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, I am not getting in the car.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Oh, don’t be an idiot. I’m the good guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you expect me to trust you?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: You’re still alive, aren’t you? What are you going to do? Stay out here in the woods with all the dead guys?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine. I’ll get in the car.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Given how you’re feeling so bad about your $200 buck phone you might want to pick up that 3 million dollar briefcase.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Take it with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At least tell me your name.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Hunt. Jackson Hunt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds made up.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: It is.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey. Hey. Can someone just please tell me what’s going on? Why am I here?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: We should be safe here for now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where did you get these?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: It’s not important. Now what’s important is that we get her back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t even know you. Why would you care?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: It’s my job. I was sent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By whom? El-Masri?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: What’s the difference?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You need to tell me who hired you and why these people took my daughter.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: That’s yours. You want to get it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How’s it mine? You shot mine.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: It’s a clone. That’s how I tracked you. Difference is, that one’s secure. It’s probably Beckett.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: You ought to let her know you’re safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not Beckett. It’s a local number. Alexis. Alexis?

utterance.speaker: GREGOR VOLKOV
utterance.content: I’m afraid not, Mr. Castle. But I am the one holding her. If you value her life you will give the phone to the man standing next to you. The one responsible for all the bloodshed in the woods.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: VOLKOV
utterance.content: It’s you. After all these years, it’s finally you.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Time to let her go, Volkov.

utterance.speaker: VOLKOV
utterance.content: The way you let Anna go? No. It’s time to end things. A life for a life. Tomorrow, 6AM. Outside the Palais Le Bon. You show, I’ll spare her. But if you don’t I will put a bullet in her brain instead of yours. And we start again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is about you?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t understand. What does this have to do with Alexis? Why would they take her?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Because I was careless. Because somehow she found out who she was. Who you were. And he knew I’d come for her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why? Why would you come for her?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Because she is my granddaughter.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Richard, I’m your father.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re telling me you’re a spy?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Intelligence asset is the term.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My dad’s a spy. Does my mom know?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Uh uh. What’d she tell you about me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, that it was a special night, she was in love, she woke up the next morning, you were gone, she never saw you again.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: That night I had just finished a job at the U.N. At least, I thought I had. The next day things went south. I had to get out of the city fast. It was a year before I was stateside again. That’s when I found out about you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’ve known about me? About us? All these years and you never once let us know you were out there?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: What I do means no communication, no relationships, to anyone. But, hey, I’ve been around. We’ve met before. Yeah. When you were about 10 years old. Your mother took you to the library and you were looking for a book and I gave you a copy of –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Casino Royale.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That book made me want to be a writer.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: I could believe it when I read your first spy novel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You read my books?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Oh yeah. I greased some wheels at the CIA when you were trying to get access to some information for research. I know that’s not much, but for a minute there it made me feel like a father. No, I’ve been checking on you, and your mom, and Alexis your whole lives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This man who has my daughter, who is he?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Gregor Volkov. KGB’s most feared agent. I killed his wife Anna at a counterintelligence op twelve years ago here in Paris. The first time he came after me I put him away in a Chechnyan prison for life. Then he escaped. He’s been trying to figure out a way to draw me out ever since.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If this was about Alexis, why would he take the other girl?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Because if he just took Alexis it wouldn’t be international news. He needed somebody high profile. He needed me to know. And now he’s got me exactly where he wants me. If I don’t show up tomorrow he will kill her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if you do show up?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: He’ll kill us both just for fun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If you know me at all you know I’ll do anything.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: You know, our only advantage is Volkov doesn’t know I’ve found him. He may not be prepared for a direct assault. If I can get inside his compound I can get Alexis out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A direct assault?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: This is our best shot. Her best shot. But we need a tactical advantage. I can’t do this alone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me what you need.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Where she’s being held, there’s a conduit supplying it that runs through the old sewer system. You cut those cables you cut their power. Lights, alarm, security video. That conduit’s the key. What do you say, kid? You’ve been playing cop for years. You ready to play spy?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: How’re we doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m almost there.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: You should see a junction box with six conduits coming from it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I see it.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: The one you want is the third one from the bottom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Wrap the charge around it like I showed you. And then attach the detonator.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, I’m setting the detonator for 30 seconds … now.

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: Hey, don’t move!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We may have a problem.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad? Dad?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis? Alexis?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad? Dad!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis! Hey. You okay?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah but, what are you doing here? The kidnap you too?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. Trying to rescue you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You shouldn’t be here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shh. It’s okay. We’re together. It’s going to be okay. You look good.

utterance.speaker: VOLKOV
utterance.content: You are like your father, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: VOLKOV
utterance.content: Getting involved where you don’t belong. Did he really think I would not be prepared for an attack?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, what’s he talking about?

utterance.speaker: VOLKOV
utterance.content: Tell her. Go on. Tell her why she’s here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s of no use to you. Let her go.

utterance.speaker: VOLKOV
utterance.content: When a man doubles his wealth, why should he give half of it away?

utterance.speaker: GUARD
utterance.content: He had this on him.

utterance.speaker: VOLKOV
utterance.content: Time to end this. I know that you are here. I know that you are close. And I want you to know that I have your son. You have 10 seconds to show yourself to my men out front. Give yourself up – – or I will kill him.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s okay.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s all right.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: You’re not going to kill my son, Volkov.

utterance.speaker: VOLKOV
utterance.content: No? And why is that?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Because you’ll be dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Get down.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Once the charge goes off there’ll be a moment when it all hits the fan. Use this to get her out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Watch your eyes, sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: And then run.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: His men will move to the front to respond to my attack. You move to the back, through these doors, and right down this corridor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about his men? What if they try to stop us?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Don’t let them.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Just keep moving until you hit the back door. I’ll be coming in the front. Don’t stop running. Ever. Not until you reach the U.S. Embassy.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: And once you reach the Embassy ask for Deputy Chief of Missions Jim Aldicot. He’ll provide you both with an official cover story. One that credits Interpol and the French police and doesn’t include me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happens to you after?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Assuming we’re both not killed, I – I disappear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, but we just –

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: That’s the job. That’s my life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but – we just met. I mean, I got a lot of questions. A lot of things I want to say. I don’t – I don’t … I – I need to have more time.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Maybe we can do that sometime, you know, some day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How will I know if you made it?

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Oh, you won’t. Not officially, at least. I know this has been tough for you, Richard, and I just want you to know, son … I’ve always been proud of you.

utterance.speaker: HUNT
utterance.content: Always.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I have never in my life been so happy to be home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Amen.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know we’re not supposed to talk about what really happened, but … thank you. For everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. That’s what fathers do.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You think he made it out?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wish I knew. You ready?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh… you’re back!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You’re back!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, it’s so great to be home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m so glad you’re okay. Please don’t do anything like that again without me, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I won’t.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s okay, Gram. I’m okay.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi, honey!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How are you?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Brilliant. You are just brilliant. Everyone must be starving. C’mon. I’ve made breakfast.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, what’s this?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, it came for you this morning. Why? Is it important?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mom, there’s something I want to tell you.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
